p: We next scaled the adjusted estimates within and between RCCS communities to the populations living in inland and lakeside areas of the Rakai region shown in figure 1A, giving a prediction for transmission patterns within the inland and the lakeside areas in which the study communities are located. The predicted proportion of transmissions was 88·7% (95% CrI 84·5–91·9) within the inland area, 5·2% (3·8–7·0) within the lakeside area, 4·3% (2·3–7·0) from inland to lakeside areas, and 1·7% (0·6–3·5) from lakeside to inland areas ( table). The predicted flow ratio from inland to lakeside areas was 2·5 (95% CrI 1·0–7·3). We report estimates of the sources of infection in each of the population groups and the recipients of transmissions from each of the population groups in the appendix (p 6).
